article.title: NASA open science data repository: open science for life in space
article.abstract: Space biology and health data are critical for the success of deep space missions and sustainable human presence off-world.

sections.introduction: The fields of space biology and space health are rapidly expanding and becoming more essential as humanity embarks on missions to the Moon, Mars, and other deep space missions beyond low Earth orbit.
sections.discussion: The successful expansion of human life into deep space hinges on profound advancements in our understanding of space biology and the critical biomedical responses and health systems developed for long-duration and long-distance spaceflight missions.

article.insights_summary: The NASA Open Science Data Repository (OSDR) is a public resource that fosters extensive engagement in spaceflight science, discovery, research, and development.
article.acknowledgments: We wish to thank the scientific community including data submitters, users and advisors for their longstanding support of OSDR.
